content.title: Intro
content.content:
1 Yule was the last day in the Shire Calendar, after 30 December, marking the end of the year.[1][note 1] Due to the Shire-reform the Yuledays always fell on the same days of the week. 1 Yule was always a Highday (Friday).[2]

Events on 1 Yule:

T.A. 3018:
The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.

content.title: Notes
content.content: ↑ On the Gregorian calendar, it would approximately correspond to 21 December.

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix D, "The Shire Calendar"
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix D, "The Calendars"
